cause.description:
This society has been formed by parents, patients, friends & well wishers.
* Introduction to Thalassaemia *
Thalassaemia or Cooley's anemia or Mediterranean anemia is a serious "Genetic Blood Disorder", affecting red pigment (Red Blood Corpuscles) of blood. Though prevalent worldwide, it is not an infectious or contagious disease. But it is emerging as a very serious health problem in India, affecting, according to W.H.O. 7% -8% of Indian population and increasing by, at least 4%-S% annually. At present public awareness is at best negligible.
It is normally confused with Iron Deficiency Anaemia
Some of the higher risk communities, where the Thalassaemia is prevalent are, Punjabis, Sindhis, Bengalis, Kacchis, Lohanas, Kunbis, Khojas, Memons, Bhanushalies etc.etc.
Main clinical forms of Thalassaemia: 1. Thalassaemia MINOR (TRAIT) CARRIER 2. Thalassaemia MAJOR (DISORDER) Disease.
1. Please donate blood at least once a year to a Thalassaemic.
2. Donating blood, brings out the best in you!
3. Become a member of M.T.S. and help us in our objectives.
cause.mission: Create public awareness towards prevention of this deadly genetic blood disorder.
